5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block 1
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: "-- Create the schema\nCREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS jdbc"

5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: "-- Create the JDBC data source that points to the nyct2010 google spreadsheet\nCREATE OR REPLACE DATA SOURCE jdbc.gsheets\nLOCATION = 'jdbc:cdata:googlesheets:OAuthVerifier=PASTE YOUR AUTH CODE HERE;InitiateOAuth=REFRESH;Spreadsheet=nyct2010'"

5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE DATA SOURCE jdbc.gsheets_test
LOCATION = 'jdbc:cdata:googlesheets:OAuthVerifier=4/1AdQt8qgP5GWnSUaI3y7TdmDZ1fAipMuYyyYbofvl_Yz0xPOX-Th-4KzIFJ4;InitiateOAuth=REFRESH;Spreadsheet=test123';

LOAD DATA INTO jdbc.test123
FROM REMOTE QUERY 'SELECT * FROM test123_Sheet1'
WITH OPTIONS (
    DATA SOURCE = 'jdbc.gsheets_test',
    ON ERROR = SKIP
)"

5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"-- Create the table
CREATE OR REPLACE MATERIALIZED EXTERNAL TABLE jdbc.nyct2010
(
    "id" INTEGER,
    "gid" INTEGER (primary_key) NOT NULL,
    "geom" GEOMETRY,
    "CTLabel" VARCHAR (16),
    "BoroCode" VARCHAR (16),
    "BoroName" VARCHAR (16),
    "CT2010" VARCHAR (16),
    "BoroCT2010" VARCHAR (16),
    "CDEligibil" VARCHAR (16),
    "NTACode" VARCHAR (16),
    "NTAName" VARCHAR (64),
    "PUMA" VARCHAR (16),
    "Shape_Leng" DOUBLE,
    "Shape_Area" DOUBLE
);"

5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"LOAD DATA INTO jdbc.nyct2010
FROM REMOTE QUERY 'SELECT * FROM nyct2010_Sheet1'
WITH OPTIONS 
(
    DATA SOURCE = 'jdbc.gsheets',
    ON ERROR = SKIP
)"

5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE SCHEMA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Tables in Kinetica are organized using schema. We will use the 'jdbc' schema to organize the tables and data objects for this example."}]}]

5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE THE DATA SOURCE","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Paste the authorization code that you generated (see prerequisites) earlier as the value for OAuthVerifier in the query below (LOCATION parameter)."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"âœŽ "},{"text":"Note","bold":true},{"text":": The CDATA connector is specified separately for each spreadsheet. "}]}]

5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"CREATE MATERIALIZED EXTERNAL TABLE "jdbc"."nyct2010"
(
    "id" INTEGER NOT NULL,
    "gid" INTEGER (primary_key) NOT NULL,
    "geom" GEOMETRY,
    "CTLabel" VARCHAR (16),
    "BoroCode" VARCHAR (16),
    "BoroName" VARCHAR (16),
    "CT2010" VARCHAR (16),
    "BoroCT2010" VARCHAR (16),
    "CDEligibil" VARCHAR (16),
    "NTACode" VARCHAR (16),
    "NTAName" VARCHAR (64),
    "PUMA" VARCHAR (16),
    "Shape_Leng" DOUBLE,
    "Shape_Area" DOUBLE
);
"

5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE THE TABLE","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"While Kinetica has a good type inferencing system, it is always a best practice to define the table schema before loading data into it. "}]}]

5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"LOAD INTO jdbc.nyct2010
FROM REMOTE QUERY 'SELECT * FROM nyct2010_Sheet1'
WITH OPTIONS 
(
    DATA SOURCE = 'jdbc.gsheets',
    ON ERROR = SKIP 
)"

5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5720b910-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"LOAD THE DATA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Data is loaded by issuing a query to the remote data source. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"âœŽ Note: ","bold":true},{"text":" The googlesheets API uses the syntax spreadsheet_sheetName to identify the sheet from which to load the data."}]}]

573f1680-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
573f1680-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"JDBC DATA SOURCES","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Java DataBase Connectivity (JDBC) is a standardized API for interacting with databases using Java programs. Kinetica offers a data source that can be used to connect to other databases and applications using a JDBC driver. We can then issue remote queries to this data source to load and export data to and from Kinetica into this data source."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CDATA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Kinetica has also partnered with CData, which is a data connectivity platform that offers jdbc drivers for 100s of different databases and applications. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"TWO ROUTES","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"There are two ways to register a JDBC data source. You can either Bring Your Own Driver (BYOD) or you can use a driver provided by CData."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"THIS DEMO","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"In this demo, we explore both the BYOD and CData route. First we will use a CData driver to load data from googlesheets into Kinetica and then we will bring our own JDBC driver to connect to a Postgres database."}]}]

573f1680-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
573f1680-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"âœŽ NOTE","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This workbook showcases certian admin features that will only work in developers edition and not on Kinetica cloud."}]}]

5741d5a0-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block 1
5741d5a0-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE DATA SOURCE jdbc.postgres_ds
LOCATION = 'jdbc:postgresql://172.17.0.3:5432/dellstore'
USER = 'postgres'
PASSWORD = 'postgres'
WITH OPTIONS
(
  JDBC_DRIVER_JAR_PATH = 'kifs://drivers/postgresql-42.4.0.jar',
  JDBC_DRIVER_CLASS_NAME = 'org.postgresql.Driver'
)"

5741d5a0-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5741d5a0-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"POSTGRES DATABASE"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Postgres is a very popular open source relational database management system. The worksheets shows how to connect to an instance of Postgres using JDBC."}]}]

5741d5a0-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5741d5a0-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"LOAD INTO jdbc.products
FROM REMOTE QUERY 'SELECT * FROM products'
WITH OPTIONS 
(
    DATA SOURCE = 'jdbc.postgres_ds'
)"

5741d5a0-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5741d5a0-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE THE DATA SOURCE","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The credential for accessing the postgres database (if using the docker version in pre-reqs) is postgres. Make sure the postgres database is up and running before registering the data source."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"âœŽ Note","bold":true},{"text":": The data source is registered for dellstore. You can try replacing it with other datasets."}]}]

5741d5a0-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
5741d5a0-c2a8-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"LOAD DATA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"In the query below, we use Kinetica's type inferencing system to directly load the data from postgres into a table without having created the table in Kinetica first."}]}]

config.html_source:
Pre-requisites

  1. Spreadsheet data: You will need access to a google spreadsheet with tabular data to complete this demo. The following link contains the data that was used for this demo. You can create a copy of this (under your google account) to repeat the same steps as those below.
  2. Authentication: Use the following link to generate the authorization code for CData. Make sure to copy and save the code.
  3. Enable Procs: Log into Gadmin and change the enable procs setting in the configuration file to true. Restart the database service.

Steps

  1. Register the data source: We will use the CData JDBC driver to register a google spreadsheet as our data source. You can read more about the CData driver here.
  2. Create the table: Kinetica has a type inferencing system. We can use that to get a first version of the DDL using the ingestion mode 'TYPE INFERENCE' (see options). We can then modify the DDL as we need to create the table in Kinetica.
  3. Load data from the data source: In the case of googlesheets, each data source points to a spreadsheet. And each sheet inside the spreadsheet contains data that can be loaded into a table. The CData driver uses the spreadsheet_sheetname syntax to identify the sheet that a SQL query will be issued to.

Pre-requisites

  1. Postgres database: Follow the instructions here to install a containerized instance of Postgres with some sample data.
  2. JDBC driver for Postgres: Download the postgres driver from the following link and load into KiFS
  3. Enable Procs: This should already be turned on if you completed the instructions in the previous worksheet.

Steps

  1. Load the driver: You can create an optional folder and load the driver using the UI into that folder.
  2. Register the data sources: The database connection string requires the address and port number of the postgres instance. You can find these via the CLI (launched via docker). You can find the port number using docker ps. Note that the data source is registered separately for each schema.
  3. Load data from the data source: The data is loaded the same way as for other JDBC data sources by issuing a remote query.
